fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 2: Visual. Main Profile (formal name); MPEG-4, Visual Coding, Main Profile (common name)

fdd:description.p: See also MP4_FF_2 and MPEG-4_V. The Main Profile was created to serve broadcast services, permitting the highest quality, and supporting arbitrarily shaped objects using grayscale coding.
The Main Profile permits the use of the following visual object types:

ul.li: Simple: rectangular video, uses intra (I) and predicted (P) video object planes (VOPs, the MPEG-4 term for frames).

Core: arbitrarily shaped video, uses a tool superset of Simple, adds bidirectional (B) video object planes (VOPs), binary shape coding, and supports temporal scalability based on sending extra P-VOPs.
Main: arbitrarily shaped video, adds to Core the coding of grayscale shapes, sprites (object in memory with all pixel information, e.g., the background of scene), and interlaced coding.
Scalable Texture: arbitrarily shaped still image with wavelet compression and incremental download.

fdd:description.p: Three compression levels are permitted; the highest accepts up to 32 objects (Simple, Core, or Main) for a maximum total bit rate of 38 Mbps.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: MPEG-4 encoding profile created to serve broadcast services, permitting the highest quality, and supporting arbitrarily shaped objects using grayscale coding.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MPEG-4 File Format, V.2, with Visual Coding (All Profiles)

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Actual adoption not known to the compilers of this document.

fdd:movingImageQF.fdd:clarity: See MPEG-4 and MPEG-4_V. Potential for greater clarity at a given picture size, data rate, and encoding algorithm, than some other MPEG-4 profiles, e.g., Simple, Simple Scalable, Advanced Simple, and Core Profiles.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicated in file wrapper and relates to "brands" defined in ISO_BMFF. Wrapping MPEG-4_V bitstreams in MP4_FF_1 would occasion the use of mp41; in MP4_FF_2, use mp42. See Part 15 of the standard, pp. 2-9, 13.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: Indicator for profile, level, version, etc.

fdd:values.fdd:note: Indicators for Main Profile, levels 2, 3, and 4 are 00110010, 00110011, 00110100, respectively. From Annex G of ISO/IEC 14496-2:2004, Table G.1
PRONOM has no corresponding entry as of July 2022.

fdd:citation.fdd:bookReference: Pereira, Fernando, and Touradj Ebrahimi, The MPEG-4 Book, Upper Saddle River, NJ: IMSC Press, 2002, p. 599.
